    pycheron.dataAcq.evalresp¶

    Modified from IRIS MUSTANG Python Version. [1] [2]

    read_Evalresp(sfft, efft, nfft, filename, date, station='*', channel='*', network='*', locid='*', units='ACC', debug=False, output='FAP', spacing='LOG')[source]¶

    Use the evalresp library to extract instrument response information from a SEED RESP-file.

    Parameters:
    • sfft (float) – starting frequency for FFT
    • efft (float) – ending frequency for FFT
    • nfft (int) – Number of FFT points between sfft and efft
    • filename (str or file) – SEED RESP-filename or open file like object with RESP information. Any object that provides a read() method will be considered to be a file like object.
    • date (obspy.core.utcdatetime.UTCDateTime) – Date of interest
    • station (str) – Station id
    • channel (str) – Channel id
    • network (str) – Network id
    • locid (str) – Location id
    • units (str) – Units to return response in. Can be either DEF, DIS, VEL or ACC
    • debug (bool) – Verbose output to stdout. Disabled by default.
    • output (str) – the style of output to present in data frame (‘CS’,’FAP’)
    • spacing (str) – select ‘LIN’ear or ‘LOG’arithmic spacing of frequency steps
    Return type:

    numpy.ndarray complex128
    Returns:

    Frequency response from SEED RESP-file of length nfft

    Footnotes

    [1]Robert Casey - IRIS - October 2016. Ideas and source code borrowed from Obspy invsim module (Copyright (C) 2008-2012 Moritz Beyreuther, Yannik Behr)
    [2]Other ideas and source code extracted from evalresp.(Copyright (C) 1997-2016 Incorporated Research Institutions for Seismology Tom McSweeney, Chad Trabant, IRIS; Ilya Dricker, Eric Thomas, Sid Hellman, Andrew Cooke, ISTI)
